the tunisian simple stitch make a chain of 12 stitches keep in mind that all the stitches should then fit on your hook if you have one with a handle you can t chain much if you have one without you can make more stitches insert your hook into the back of the second loops from your hook see blue dots yarn over and pull througth the loop you have two loops on your hook e h no yes c o r c e insert your hoonk into the back of the next loop yarn over and pull through the loop you have three loops on your hook n a repeat this process until you e have inserted your hook jthrough all the stitches you should have as many loops on your hook as chains you have crocheted it should look like this the next pictures are from another project the maelle bag and are useful to explain the tunisian simple stitch you can also watch video tutorials such as this one page 2 to make the return pass yarn over and pull through one = make a chain stitch you still have the same as the number of chain you had initially made s then yarn over and pull through t two loops you now have one less e than the amount you had initially chained h c o r c repeat *yarn over and pull through two loops* until you e have one loop left n n a e vertical
